summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous relevant resolutions, condemns the 14 February 2005 terrorist bombing and other attacks in Lebanon, and reaffirms that those involved must be held accountable.

Examining the report of the International Independent Investigation Commission (S/2008/752), the Council notes the Commission's request to extend its mandate until 28 February 2009 to ensure continuity of investigations and transfer operations to The Hague.

Noting the Secretary-General's announcement that the Special Tribunal for Lebanon will commence functioning on 1 March 2009, the Council:

1. Welcomes the Commission's report;
2. Decides to extend the Commission's mandate until 28 February 2009;
3. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
